ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 86
ygData.msgSnippet: Well the freeport Militia don t care about Religion, but any guard with Sir in his name surely will as they are all paladins of Marr.  Unfortunately there is a
ygData.messageBody:
Well the freeport Militia don't care about Religion, but any guard with Sir
in his name surely will as they are all paladins of Marr. Unfortunately
there is a paladin in the bank. I'm not sure if the paladins will attack
based on religion the way the dark elf dragoons will, but be ready to run
for the zone if you try to test it out.

-----Original Message-----
From: Brad Leon [mailto:Brad.Leon@...]
Sent: Friday, June 18, 1999 6:33 AM
To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Digest Number 86


From: Brad Leon <Brad.Leon@...>

Greetings all!

I am a relatively young Enchanter (level 5) and am seeking some knowledge.
How do the Illusion spells work? I have both Illusion:Human and Illusion
Half-elf and have tested them out briefly. I am a Dark Elf, so when I
changed to a human, I lost my Ultravision, making everything pitch black.
At least the Half-elves get infravision. My questions are these: If I
change to human, do I get the experience point bonus (or rather lose the XP
penalty for being a non-human)? I've heard that the Illusion spells do not
mask religious identity. How safe would I be walking in Freeport with one
of the illusion spells active? Would I still be KOS?

When that Race war server opens up, Enchanters are going to be the assassins
of Norrath. Invisibility, charming someone and making them attack their own
guards, Illusion spells to walk among the enemy unnoticed...

Krye 5th Enchanter of Innoruuk
